title: Rust devil
data:
***Version [0.17](/0.17 "0.17")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                             | [rF+++](/Fire "Fire") [rC+](/Cold "Cold") [rElec](/Electricity "Electricity") [rPois+](/Poison "Poison") [rMiasma](/Miasma "Miasma") [rN+++](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") [rTorm](/Torment "Torment") |

| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A hideous humanoid figure with rust-spotted metal skin. Its touch causes armour and weapons to rust and decay, becoming nearly useless until repaired. |

## Useful Info

**Rust devils** are [tier-4](/Tier-4_demon "Tier-4 demon") [demons](/Demon "Demon") with multiple resistances and moderately powerful physical attacks. Although less intimidating than most demons, their real strength lies in the fact that their attacks inflict [corrosion](/Corrosion "Corrosion"), significantly hampering your ability to take down foes quickly or endure further strikes. They are a common sight in [the Iron City of Dis](/The_Iron_City_of_Dis "The Iron City of Dis").

## Tips & Tricks

- Corrosion resistance will certainly help prevent them from inflicting corrosion upon you, but may not be that necessary. They are weak enough that most well-prepared characters will be able to take them out long before they land a corroding hit. Just be wary of letting them engage you while you're distracted with another foe; [Hell](/Hell "Hell") is not the sort of place that gives you time to repair your equipment between fights.

## History

Rust devils were added in [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), replacing [iron devils](/Iron_devil "Iron devil").
html:
Rust devil

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.17: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
rust devil 4 
HP 29-59
HD 8
XP 455
Speed 10
AC 10
EV 8
Will 60
Attack1 12 (hit: corrode)


Resistances rF+++
rC+
rElec
rPois+
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Demonic
Size Medium
Type rust devil, rust devil
Flags
A hideous humanoid figure with rust-spotted metal skin. Its touch causes armour and weapons to rust and decay, becoming nearly useless until repaired.

Useful Info

Rust devils are tier-4 demons with multiple resistances and moderately powerful physical attacks. Although less intimidating than most demons, their real strength lies in the fact that their attacks inflict corrosion, significantly hampering your ability to take down foes quickly or endure further strikes. They are a common sight in the Iron City of Dis.

Tips & Tricks

  • Corrosion resistance will certainly help prevent them from inflicting corrosion upon you, but may not be that necessary. They are weak enough that most well-prepared characters will be able to take them out long before they land a corroding hit. Just be wary of letting them engage you while you're distracted with another foe; Hell is not the sort of place that gives you time to repair your equipment between fights.

History

Rust devils were added in 0.16, replacing iron devils.

rawPage:
{{version017}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Rust devils''' are [[Tier-4 demon|tier-4]] [[demon]]s with multiple resistances and moderately powerful physical attacks. Although less intimidating than most demons, their real strength lies in the fact that their attacks inflict [[corrosion]], significantly hampering your ability to take down foes quickly or endure further strikes. They are a common sight in [[the Iron City of Dis]].

==Tips & Tricks==
*Corrosion resistance will certainly help prevent them from inflicting corrosion upon you, but may not be that necessary. They are weak enough that most well-prepared characters will be able to take them out long before they land a corroding hit. Just be wary of letting them engage you while you're distracted with another foe; [[Hell]] is not the sort of place that gives you time to repair your equipment between fights.

==History==
Rust devils were added in [[0.16]], replacing [[iron devil]]s.
